page.title: 04 ABINGTON PARK
page.content: The park lies to the east of Northampton, one mile from the town centre along the Wellingborough Road.It covers an area of 117 acres lying between four roads and divided into two parts. The upper park contains the Abington manor house(now a museum),a specially planted garden for the blind, a tea shop, bandstand, aviary, bowling green,tennis courts and a putting course. The lower park contains a play area, golf course, and football,rugby and cricket pitches.Three lakes are inhabited by wildfowl. A pigeonery (once a water tower)stands near the childrens' boating lake. There are many varieties of trees in the park. Abington Parish Church,which dates from the 13th. Century, is situated in the park. Every year, the Northampton Municipal Show is held in the lower park.
